title: Frederick C. Leonard Sr. (National Archives and Records Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Frederick C. Leonard Sr. Born Feb. 9, 1892; died Nov. 21, 1959.

The late Mr. Leonard was a decorated veteran who attended former President Eisenhower's Inauguration Ball.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that NARA has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Department of Labor staffers who have been detailed to the Social Security Administration in 2025

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In a sworn declaration by Deputy Administrator Florence Felix-Watson in AFL-CIO vs. Social Security Administration (source https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.277150/gov.uscourts.dcd.277150.53.1.pdf), she testified that on "On February 18, 2025, we began onboarding and training Employee 3, a Schedule C Policy Advisor, detailed from the Department of Labor to SSA. The agreement finalizing his onboarding is dated February 22, 2025. His duties currently relate to improper payments and SSA’s Death Master File (containing information about decedents from SSA records)."

This FOIA is to request details on who that person is and any other relevant details of that detailing arrangement (like a memorandum of understanding or coordination emails for this detailing arrangement). If possible, I would like to request whatever onboarding details for that employee at Department of Labor, including if they had a signed SF-61. If this employee is a DOGE-related hire, I would expect the span of time to search for such records to be from January 20, 2025 to February 18 or the vicinity.

Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Harris

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All Patron Incident Reports submitted for the Area Manager 5 North Region from March 1, 2025 through March 20, 2025 inclusive of those dates.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs for the purpose of public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin
